Alarm Pembajakan di Pesawat 'Terpencet', Bandara Belanda Riuh
07 Nov 2019, 04:33 by AFP, https://www.facebook.com/CNNIndonesia


Ilustrasi kabin pesawat terbang. (hxdyl/Thinkstock)

Jakarta, CNN Indonesia -- Bandara internasional Schiphol di Amsterdam, Belanda sempat heboh pada Rabu (6/11) gara-gara seorang pilot tidak sengaja menyalakan alarm pembajakan dari dalam pesawat. Kejadian ini memicu aktivitas besar dari kepolisian setempat.Alarm diaktifkan pilot di pesawat milik maskapai Spanyol, Air Europa, penerbangan dari Amsterdam ke Madrid, yang kemudian membuat banyak kendaraan darurat berkerumun di sekitar pesawat. Air Europa telah meminta maaf atas insiden tersebut."Alarm yang salah. Telah diaktifkan di penerbangan Amsterdam-Madrid pada sore ini, itu kesalahan, tanda bahaya yang memicu protokol mengatasi pembajakan di bandara," kata perusahaan itu melalui Twitter."Tidak ada yang terjadi, semua penumpang selamat dan menunggu segera terbang. Kami sangat meminta maaf," tulisnya lagi.



Kepolisian Belanda sebelumnya mengatakan bakal menginvestigasi 'situasi mencurigakan', namun beberapa jam kemudian mengumumkan para penumpang dan kru telah 'meninggalkan pesawat dengan aman'.Dari gambar yang ditunjukkan kepolisian, pesawat yang mengangkut 27 penumpang itu dikelilingi mobil polisi dan ambulans. Schiphol merupakan bandara tersibuk dan gerbang utama untuk masuk ke Eropa. Selama setahun bandara ini dikunjungi 70 juta penumpang. (fea)

Piracy Alarm on Plane 'Squashed', Holland Airport is Riuh
Nov 7 2019, 04:33 by AFP, https://www.facebook.com/CNNIndonesia


Illustration of an aircraft cabin. (hxdyl / Thinkstock)

Jakarta, CNN Indonesia - Schiphol international airport in Amsterdam, the Netherlands had a stir on Wednesday (6/11) because a pilot accidentally turned on a piracy alarm from inside the plane. This incident sparked great activity from the local police. Armarm activated the pilot on a plane belonging to the Spanish airline, Air Europa, flight from Amsterdam to Madrid, which then made many emergency vehicles huddled around the plane. Air Europa has apologized for the incident. "The alarm was wrong. It was activated on an Amsterdam-Madrid flight this afternoon, it was a mistake, a danger sign that triggered a protocol to overcome piracy at the airport," the company said via Twitter. "Nothing happened "All passengers survived and were waiting to fly immediately. We are very sorry," he wrote again.



Dutch police had previously said it would investigate "suspicious situations", but hours later announced the passengers and crew had "left the plane safely". From the picture shown by the police, the plane carrying 27 passengers was surrounded by police cars and ambulances. Schiphol is the busiest airport and main gate for entry into Europe. During the year the airport was visited by 70 million passengers. (fea)
